channel.title: How do I delete saved data (cache, temp files, etc) from Whonix?
channel.description: Hello, on my host machine, I use CCleaner. But I've been reading that using CCleaner will not clean the saved data from the VM's (I'm using virtualbox). How can I securely delete these files from the VM's? Can I use bleachbit on the VM? Any suggestions? Thanks.

item.title: How do I delete saved data (cache, temp files, etc) from Whonix?
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
Bleachbit will work on VMs. But that’s a lot of faith you’re putting in it to know all of your specific workflows.

Use full disk encryption:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Advanced_Security_Guide#Full_Disk_Encryption

Read this first:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#Is_there_a_substitute_for_Whonix.27s_lack_of_an_Amnesic_feature_.2F_Live_CD.2FDVD.3F_Forensics.3F

Use Virtualbox snapshots:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Security_Guide#VM_Snapshots
https://www.virtualbox.org/manual/ch01.html#snapshots

Search Internet for “virtualbox snapshots” for more tutorials.
